meanings.definition: The condition of having fused petals in a flower.
meanings.sent1: Sympetaly can be seen in certain flowers where the petals are joined together.
meanings.sent2: The sympetaly of the rose creates a beautiful and unique appearance.
meanings.sent3: The sympetaly of the daisy made it look like a single, colorful unit.
meanings.sent4: The sympetaly of the tulip symbolized unity and harmony in nature.
meanings.sent5: The sympetaly of the sunflower made it stand out among the other blooms.

meanings.definition: The state of having petals that are joined together at their bases.
meanings.sent1: In the garden, the sympetaly of the lily caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The sympetaly of the orchid gave it a distinct shape compared to other flowers.
meanings.sent3: The sympetaly of the poppy made it seem like the petals were holding hands.
meanings.sent4: The sympetaly of the carnation was a reminder of the interconnectedness of nature.
meanings.sent5: The sympetaly of the hibiscus added an interesting twist to the floral arrangement.
